trans-unit.source: Deploy and Manage Notification Hubs using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Deploy and Manage Notification Hubs using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: How to Create and Manage Notification Hubs Using PowerShell for Automation
trans-unit.target: How to Create and Manage Notification Hubs Using PowerShell for Automation

trans-unit.source: Deploy and Manage Notification Hubs using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Deploy and Manage Notification Hubs using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to use Create and Manage Azure Notification Hubs using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to use Create and Manage Azure Notification Hubs using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: The following common automation tasks are shown in this topic.
trans-unit.target: The following common automation tasks are shown in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Create a Notification Hub
trans-unit.target: Create a Notification Hub

trans-unit.source: Set Credentials
trans-unit.target: Set Credentials

trans-unit.source: If you also need to create a new service bus namespace for your notification hubs, see <link><linkText>Manage Service Bus with PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you also need to create a new service bus namespace for your notification hubs, see <link><linkText>Manage Service Bus with PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Managing Notifications Hubs is not supported directly by the cmdlets included with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Managing Notifications Hubs is not supported directly by the cmdlets included with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: The best approach from PowerShell is to reference the Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll assembly.
trans-unit.target: The best approach from PowerShell is to reference the Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll assembly.

trans-unit.source: The assembly is distributed with the <link><linkText>Service Bus NuGet package</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The assembly is distributed with the <link><linkText>Service Bus NuGet package</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Azure is a subscription-based platform.
trans-unit.target: Azure is a subscription-based platform.

trans-unit.source: For more
trans-unit.target: For more

trans-unit.source: information about obtaining a subscription, see [Purchase Options],
trans-unit.target: information about obtaining a subscription, see [Purchase Options],

trans-unit.source: [Member Offers], or [Free Trial].
trans-unit.target: [Member Offers], or [Free Trial].

trans-unit.source: A computer with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: A computer with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell].
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell].

trans-unit.source: A general understanding of PowerShell scripts, NuGet packages, and the .NET Framework.
trans-unit.target: A general understanding of PowerShell scripts, NuGet packages, and the .NET Framework.

trans-unit.source: Including a reference to the .NET assembly for Service Bus
trans-unit.target: Including a reference to the .NET assembly for Service Bus

trans-unit.source: Managing Azure Notification Hubs is not yet included with the PowerShell cmdlets in Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Managing Azure Notification Hubs is not yet included with the PowerShell cmdlets in Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: To provision notification hubs and other service bus entities that are not exposed through the existing cmdlets, you can use the .NET client for
trans-unit.target: To provision notification hubs and other service bus entities that are not exposed through the existing cmdlets, you can use the .NET client for

trans-unit.source: Service Bus in the <link><linkText>Service Bus NuGet package</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus in the <link><linkText>Service Bus NuGet package</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: First, make sure your script can locate the Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll assembly, which is installed as a NuGet package in a Visual Studio project.
trans-unit.target: First, make sure your script can locate the Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll assembly, which is installed as a NuGet package in a Visual Studio project.

trans-unit.source: In order to be flexible, the script performs these steps:
trans-unit.target: In order to be flexible, the script performs these steps:

trans-unit.source: Determines the path at which it was invoked.
trans-unit.target: Determines the path at which it was invoked.

trans-unit.source: Traverses the path until it finds a folder named packages.
trans-unit.target: Traverses the path until it finds a folder named packages.

trans-unit.source: This folder is created when you install NuGet packages for Visual Studio projects.
trans-unit.target: This folder is created when you install NuGet packages for Visual Studio projects.

trans-unit.source: Recursively searches the packages folder for an assembly named Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll.
trans-unit.target: Recursively searches the packages folder for an assembly named Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll.

trans-unit.source: References the assembly so that the types are available for later use.
trans-unit.target: References the assembly so that the types are available for later use.

trans-unit.source: Here's how these steps are implemented in a PowerShell script:
trans-unit.target: Here's how these steps are implemented in a PowerShell script:

trans-unit.source: Create the NamespaceManager class
trans-unit.target: Create the NamespaceManager class

trans-unit.source: To provision Notification Hubs and other Service Bus entities, create an instance of the <link><linkText>NamespaceManager</linkText><title></title></link> class from the SDK.
trans-unit.target: To provision Notification Hubs and other Service Bus entities, create an instance of the <link><linkText>NamespaceManager</linkText><title></title></link> class from the SDK.

trans-unit.source: You can use the [Get-AzureSBAuthorizationRule] cmdlet included with Azure PowerShell to retrieve an authorization rule that's used to provide a connection string.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [Get-AzureSBAuthorizationRule] cmdlet included with Azure PowerShell to retrieve an authorization rule that's used to provide a connection string.

trans-unit.source: We'll store a reference to the NamespaceManager instance in the $NamespaceManager variable.
trans-unit.target: We'll store a reference to the NamespaceManager instance in the $NamespaceManager variable.

trans-unit.source: We will use $NamespaceManager to provision a notification hub.
trans-unit.target: We will use $NamespaceManager to provision a notification hub.

trans-unit.source: Provisioning a new Notification Hub
trans-unit.target: Provisioning a new Notification Hub

trans-unit.source: To provision a new notification hub, use the [.NET API for Service Bus].
trans-unit.target: To provision a new notification hub, use the [.NET API for Service Bus].

trans-unit.source: This article focuses only on notification hubs.
trans-unit.target: This article focuses only on notification hubs.

trans-unit.source: To work with other service bus entities, see <link><linkText>Manage Service Bus with PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To work with other service bus entities, see <link><linkText>Manage Service Bus with PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In this part of the script you set up four local variables.
trans-unit.target: In this part of the script you set up four local variables.

trans-unit.source: $Namespace : Set this to the name of the namespace where you want to create a notification hub.
trans-unit.target: $Namespace : Set this to the name of the namespace where you want to create a notification hub.

trans-unit.source: $Path : Set this path to the name of the new notification hub.
trans-unit.target: $Path : Set this path to the name of the new notification hub.

trans-unit.source: For example, "MyHub".
trans-unit.target: For example, "MyHub".

trans-unit.source: $WnsPackageSid : Set this to the package SID for you Windows App from the Windows Dev Center.
trans-unit.target: $WnsPackageSid : Set this to the package SID for you Windows App from the Windows Dev Center.

trans-unit.source: $WnsSecretkey: Set this to the secret key for you Windows App from the Windows Dev Center.
trans-unit.target: $WnsSecretkey: Set this to the secret key for you Windows App from the Windows Dev Center.

trans-unit.source: These variables are used to connect to your Service Bus namespace and create a new Notification Hub configured to handle Windows Notification Services (WNS) notifications with WNS credentials for a Windows App.
trans-unit.target: These variables are used to connect to your Service Bus namespace and create a new Notification Hub configured to handle Windows Notification Services (WNS) notifications with WNS credentials for a Windows App.

trans-unit.source: For information on obtaining the package SID and secret key see, the <link><linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: For information on obtaining the package SID and secret key see, the <link><linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: The script snippet uses the NamespaceManager object to check to see if the Notification Hub identified by $Path exists.
trans-unit.target: The script snippet uses the NamespaceManager object to check to see if the Notification Hub identified by $Path exists.

trans-unit.source: If it does not exist, the script will create an NotificationHubDescription with WNS credentials and pass that to the NamespaceManager class CreateNotificationHub method.
trans-unit.target: If it does not exist, the script will create an NotificationHubDescription with WNS credentials and pass that to the NamespaceManager class CreateNotificationHub method.

trans-unit.target: Some ready-made scripts are also available for download:
